make up.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to combine together to form something
make up.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Women make up only a small proportion of the prison population.
The committee is made up of representatives from every state.
make up.translation[0].definitions[0].no: Make up is not used in the progressive in this meaning You say
Oxygen makes up roughly 20% of the atmosphere
Oxygen is making up roughly 20% of the atmosphere
However, the participle form making up is often used
Customers under 25 are important, making up a quarter of the total
make up.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to pretend that something is true in order to deceive someone
make up.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: I think they’re making the whole thing up.
make up.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to produce a new story, song, game etc by thinking
make up.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Nick made up a song about them.
When you’re the boss you can make up your own rules.
I’ve given talks so many times that now I just make them up as  I go along (=think of things to say as I am speaking).
make up.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to prepare something by mixing things or putting things together
make up.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: I could make up a bed for you on the sofa.
Can you make up a bottle of milk for the baby?
make up.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to put make-up (=special coloured substances)  on someone’s face in order to make them look better or different
make up.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: They made him up as an old man for the last act of the play.
One lucky winner will have the chance to be made up and photographed.
make up.translation[0].definitions[5].de: to add to an amount in order to bring it up to the level that is needed
make up.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: I saved as much as I could, and my parents made up the rest.
The company will be forced to pay $6 million to make up the difference.
make up.translation[0].definitions[6].de: to work at times when you do not usually work, because you have not done as much work as you should
make up.translation[0].definitions[6].ex: I’m trying to make up the time I lost while I was sick.
Is it OK if I make the work up next week?
make up.translation[0].definitions[7].de: to become friendly with someone again after you have had an argument
make up.translation[0].definitions[7].ex: Oh come on! Why don’t you just kiss and make up?
Have you made up with Patty yet?
make up.translation[0].definitions[8].de: to produce something from cloth by cutting and sewing
make up.translation[0].definitions[8].ex: The dress had been made up to her exact requirements.
I plan on making that material up into a dress.
make up.translation[1].definitions[0].de: coloured substances that are put on your face to improve or change your appearance
make up.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: I don’t usually wear much make-up.
make up.translation[1].definitions[1].de: the make-up of a group or team is the combination of people that are in it
make up.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: We should change the make-up of the team.
make up.translation[1].definitions[2].de: a test that you take in school when you were not able to take a previous test
make up.translation[1].note_box[0].secti: They’re not allowed to wear make-up to school.
Gloria watched her mother put on her make-up.
I’ll do your make-up for you, if you want.
Take off eye make-up gently, using a cotton ball.
She went into the bathroom to touch up her makeup.
Grace wiped her eyes, smudging her make-up.
a girl in high heels and heavy make-up
She was wearing far too much eye make-up.
the elaborate stage make-up for ‘The Lion King’
His face was covered by thick pancake makeup.
the chief make-up artist on the film
make up.translation[1].note_box[1].secti: coloured substances that are put on your face to improve or change your appearance
I don’t usually wear much make-up.
creams, powders etc that you use on your face and body in order to look more attractive
a range of cosmetics and toiletries
a substance you use for adding colour to your lips, in the shape of a small stick
She was wearing bright red lipstick.
coloured cream or powder that you put on your eyelids
something you use for adding a line of colour at the edges of your eyelids to make your eyes look bigger or more noticeable
a dark substance you use to colour your eyelashes and make them look thicker
red or pink cream or powder used for making your cheeks look slightly more pink
a cream the same colour as your skin that you put on your face before the rest of your make-up
make up.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to combine together to form a particular total or result
make up.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: Plastic bags now make up 60% of all bags used in grocery stores.
make up.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: Your accountant will make up your accounts and prepare your tax return.
